headline.main: New Estimates Question Savings from Farm Bills

docs.abstract: Farm bills passed by the full Senate and the House Agriculture Committee in 2012 would cost billions more this year if they were enacted without changes, according to a new estimate from the Congressional Budget Office.
docs.snippet: Farm bills passed by the full Senate and the House Agriculture Committee in 2012 would cost billions more this year if they were enacted without changes, according to a new estimate from the Congressional Budget Office.

docs.abstract: A decade-long study of more than 3,000 women found that dietary iron may reduce the risk for premenstrual syndrome, while potassium intake may increase it.
docs.snippet: A decade-long study of more than 3,000 women found that dietary iron may reduce the risk for premenstrual syndrome, while potassium intake may increase it.

docs.lead_paragraph: The cracked wheat product can lend a nutty flavor to a variety of dishes.

headline.seo: Bulgur, Spinach and Tomato Casserole — Recipes for Health
headline.main: For Flavor and Versatility, Add Bulgur

docs.snippet: The cracked wheat product can lend a nutty flavor to a variety of dishes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Women are producing ever more food, but not reaping enough gains.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Olivier De Schutter notes farming across the developing world is increasingly overseen by women; identifies ways in which governments and organizations can empower such women by removing obstacles that frustrate their rise out of poverty and hunger.
docs.snippet: Women are producing ever more food, but not reaping enough gains.

docs.lead_paragraph: Unless a deal is reached, the $85 billion in cuts will affect programs that help low-income Americans, including those that provide housing vouchers and fortified baby formula.

headline.seo: Poor Face Most Pain As Automatic Budget Cuts Take Effect
headline.main: As Automatic Budget Cuts Go Into Effect, Poor May Be Hit Particularly Hard
headline.print_headline: As Automatic Budget Cuts Go Into Effect, Poor May Be Hit Particularly Hard

docs.abstract: Automatic cuts of $85 billion working their way through the federal budget spare many programs that aid the poorest and most vulnerable Americans, including the Children’s Health Insurance Program and food stamps; sequestration cuts, however, still contain billions of dollars in mandatory budget reductions in programs that help low-income Americans.
docs.snippet: Unless a deal is reached, the $85 billion in cuts will affect programs that help low-income Americans, including those that provide housing vouchers and fortified baby formula.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the widening world of classes taught online, new technologies are helping to ensure that students on distant laptops are doing their own work.

headline.seo: New Technologies Aim to Foil Online Course Cheating
headline.main: Keeping an Eye on Online Test-Takers
headline.print_headline: Keeping an Eye On Online Test-Takers

docs.abstract: Anne Eisenberg Novelties column observes that in widening world of online classes, new technologies are helping to ensure that students are doing their own work.
docs.snippet: In the widening world of classes taught online, new technologies are helping to ensure that students on distant laptops are doing their own work.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a trend seen across Europe, Hungary has imposed taxes on salt, sugar and the ingredients in energy drinks, hoping to raise revenues and spur healthier eating habits.

headline.seo: Hungary Experiments With Food Tax to Coax Healthier Habits
headline.main: Hungary Tries a Dash of Taxes to Promote Healthier Eating Habits
headline.print_headline: Hungary Tries a Dash of Taxes to Promote Healthier Eating Habits

docs.abstract: Hungary has imposed taxes on salt, sugar and the ingredients in energy drinks in past 18 months hoping both to raise revenues and force those who are eating unhealthy foods to pay a little more toward the country’s underfinanced health system; taxation of unhealthy foods is something of trend across Europe, with many nations having either instituted such taxes or considered them.
docs.snippet: In a trend seen across Europe, Hungary has imposed taxes on salt, sugar and the ingredients in energy drinks, hoping to raise revenues and spur healthier eating habits.

byline.contributor: Michael M. Grynbaum contributed reporting from New York, and Gabriella Horn from Budapest.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study has infused the field of cardiovascular medicine with optimism, as scientists are calling for similarly rigorous studies of other popular diets.

headline.main: Experts Want More Studies of Diet’s Role for the Heart
headline.print_headline: Experts Want More Studies Of Diet’s Role For the Heart

docs.abstract: Study published in The New England Journal of Medicine shows for first time that Mediterranean--high in olive oil, fish or nuts--diet can have effect as powerful as drugs in preventing heart attacks, strokes and deaths from cardiovascular disease; study has infused field of cardiovascular medicine with optimism and scientists are calling for similarly rigorous studies of other popular diets.
docs.snippet: A study has infused the field of cardiovascular medicine with optimism, as scientists are calling for similarly rigorous studies of other popular diets.

docs.lead_paragraph: The British are embracing a weight-loss plan that involves five days of eating and drinking whatever you want, and fasting for two days a week.

headline.seo: England Develops a Voracious Appetite for a New Diet
headline.main: England Develops a Voracious Appetite for a New Diet
headline.print_headline: England Develops a Voracious Appetite for a New Diet

docs.abstract: British are embracing weight-loss plan promoted in best-selling diet book The Fast Diet, written by Michael Mosley and Mimi Spencer, advocating five days of eating and drinking anything and then fasting for two days a week.
docs.snippet: The British are embracing a weight-loss plan that involves five days of eating and drinking whatever you want, and fasting for two days a week.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans who applaud the budget cuts are cheering for misery.

headline.seo: As the Budget Cuts Hit Home

docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes House Republicans who are enthusiastic about scheduled deep, automatic spending cuts; warns cuts, which will seriously diminish nutrition aid and federal unemployment benefits, will do most damage to poorest and most vulnerable Americans.
docs.snippet: Republicans who applaud the budget cuts are cheering for misery.
